title: Traditional GP skin after his update please.
body:
I love GP, and i really like whats coming in his Kit Rework. However, I do not like what is coming to his character model.  GP's a badass, not a serious pirate as far as i'm concerned.

Can we get a traditional skin for him, please?

replies.body:
[A Rioter](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/kRdBlugE-looks-like-traditional-skins-are-a-thing-of-the-past?comment=0000) earlier today made a post on the subject of traditional skins.Yes,it's a copy & paste of another Rioter's post,but still relevant.

Long story short,they're done with traditional skins.

I hate this. ;.;

I really wanted a traditional Scion skin and will forever be disappointed that they decided against it.  Same with GP.  Upgrades like this, change the model so drastically, that for me it's hardly anything like the original character.  I understand the want and need for the upgrades and appreciate them overall, but I'd like to be able to have a traditional skin so I can take a step back in time and play as that goofy green zombie with the Schwarzenegger voiceover.  Or the goofy "yo-ho" pirate that is the current GP.  They both look so serious after their reworks, and again I get why Riot would want to make it so and I don't think it looks bad or anything; but it doesn't stop me from missing the goofiness that initially drew me to these characters.
I feel the same, now GP is old with short legs and Sion have a generic angry voice over .

Gangplank's new visuals don't make him a weaker character. While he does look older and stouter, it's to give him a more experienced and solid feel than before. Now he actually looks like a legit vicious pirate captain with Bilgewater under his boot rather than some random rabble-rouser. The new look is supposed to be cruel and closer to real pirates than his old tropey genericness.

I'd even pay legendary prices for a color similar Sion just as long as they brought the voice back, "GET ON MY CHOPPER!" <3  Also would buy a GP original but the current model is no good. He's so short and fat. He looks like he ate GP!

I fail to see how in the world you would even make a traditional sion skin for the new Sion. You guys ask way too much of these guys on certain things. A GP one could be possible, but their models aren't even the same shape anymore or work the same anymore. It wouldn't even be NEAR the Sion you remember.

It would have the size, etc of the new model, but the armor/axe/voiceover of the old model (or closer to the older model) and a different skin tone and some hair.  That's not really asking too much (maybe for a free skin, but I'd gladly pay for it); it'll be just like any other skin.  Having a different model wouldn't be too bad to do either, a lot of recent skins (StarGuardian Lux, Guardian of the Sands Rammus, the new  card one for Ez, the dinosaur ones) have entirely different models or at the very least different models for the heads.  Seems like their new go-to thing, actually.  Though, again, I would be happy with the current model, just skinned with traditional armor/colors and the old VO.   That wouldn't take too much effort.  Just as much as any 750 skin or maybe a 975 skin.  Same goes for GP.

Also, to me, the core of the traditional skins would be the traditional voiceover.  I miss the goofiness the characters used to have.  I'm not disliking the reworks at all (like, I agree with everything Delioth said for the most part) but it would be nice to be able to go back to the old silliness of the original character every so often.
Thanks for posting this! :]

Let me write this thank you and tell nothing about the thing in question. Such usefullness.

So this is what our community treats as "communicating", this is a joke.

I'm sorry you feel that way. 

I was thanking Jeddy017 for posting the explanation for why we no longer make traditional skins.

No offense, but if you actually communicated with the community on serious threads with meaningfull words i wouldnt feel that way. Because any time i look up to see a rioter write something its on the lines of "Thank you for suggestion" (that we will never remember again) "Thanks for the feedback" (which we will ignore), and other simmilar iterations of those sentences.

MY point is, why do you waste time on  threads like these to say useless stuff when you and someone else could go on the threads that actually receive attention and have many good points. The ones that have valid critisism and suggestions.

I know you actually wont even bat an eye to them most likely but at least make it look like you care.

I'd disagree that myself,  and other Rioters do not communicate on serious threads. 

To elaborate on the feedback comment - I work as a Content QA Analyst on the skins team, and I'm one of the people collecting feedback on content. 

When we thank someone for the feedback, we mean it. We really appreciate players taking time out of their day to let us know if they love/hate something, as it helps us improve the content we're currently working on, as well as what we can improve in future content. 

Part of what I do when new content comes out is to collect feedback from various platforms (boards, Reddit, etc.) and compile the feedback into an email which the team working on the content then discusses. 

To give you an idea of the feedback we receive and how we process it (at least on the skins team) - 

* **Firecracker Jinx** - We receive player feedback that part of Jinx is her tattoo, and she didn't have one in this skin, and that we'd also taken her tattoo away on her Mafia skin. Based on that feedback, we gave her a jade dragon tattoo, as suggested by players. 
* **Blood Moon Elise** - This particular skin changed color three times based on player feedback. She went from her initial pink, which players felt didn't fit with the Blood Moon thematic, to red, which players didn't agree with either, to a happy medium between the two. 

> MY point is, why do you waste time on threads like these to say useless stuff when you and someone else could go on the threads that actually receive attention and have many good points. The ones that have valid critisism and suggestions.

There are many threads that contain good points, and many of them do get addressed. For example, [this post](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/wsPIoEAj-sea-hunter-aatrox-update-fixes) where players expressed that they'd like Sea Hunter Aatrox to better match his splash. This was good feedback that I felt should be addressed. 

Aside from the serious posts, we also like to have fun, and will also comment on boards like Misc. or Community Creations. 

Hope this clears a bit of this up. :]

As you are part of the only Riot team that seems to change things already on the PBE, I must thank you. 

Actually I don't think you're on the skins team anymore. Still!
I'm still on the Skins team. :3
Oh. Than my comment continues to stand!

> To elaborate on the feedback comment - I work as a Content QA Analyst on the skins team, and I'm one of the people collecting feedback on content. 


Wait wait wait...so you were the one responsible for Trundle and Sejuani's skin being only available for such a bloody short window after their VU?


Because I won't lie...Sejuani's VU was, and still is, godawful, and it's one of the reason why I still refuse to buy her. I've said it before and I'll say it again. It's out of character and just screams of reactionary editing more than any actual effort. 

As for Trundle...before Sion's rework, he was the closest thing to a giant zombie. And okay, yeah fine, Sion reworked, fullfills that niche now. You win there. But with Sejuani, the designers are clearly terrified of the concept of a fearless female barbarian, something the Traditional skin reflects.


Economically, **what do you have to lose** for giving players the choice to switch to a champion's Traditional skin? Especially in these two cases where the Traditional are objectively better than the disappointing new looks.
------------------
**PS** - terribly sorry if you have no part to play in that decision though! Their questionable VU's along with how their Traditional skins have been handled have always been a point of contention for me. That and...Cassiopeia being screwed over so hard.

I'm sorry you're not a fan of the VUs.

Champion Update handles any kind of update to existing content (including traditional skins). I'm on the Skins team, and we only handle creating new content, such as new skins (including champion launch; Champion designs the initial look of the champion). 

Unfortunately, I don't have much more insight as far as the VU or the traditional skins. D:

Alright no hard feelings. 

Still wish we knew who the Rioter who is in charge of the Traditional skin debacle so we atleast know WHO to ask rather than firing in the dark though.


**PS** - on a side note, I love ~70% of your VU's. It's just that...with Sejuani, completely out of character. And with Trundle, he has **zero** decent skins and his rotting zombie giant look was his best look. But hey, MF turned out great. Her gameplay? Not so great, but that's a different field of expertise...

I however enjoy yhr new Sej. The bikini always confused me, and I love the new Bristle (I like monsters and this looks like a cross between a boar, bear, and a wolf). However, I can see why others enjoy t.sej over the new one

Just a suggestion in future reworks do a simple little thing since these threads annoy me, Have A stickied thread with the quote from the Sion rework which says "Insert Champion Here" WILL NOT GET A TRADITIONAL SKIN THREADS RELATED TO REQUESTS ABOUT THAT WILL BE DELETED AS SPAM. and with that you do not need to waste your time about that and can instead focus on things that are reasonable to work on instead such as seeing what it is that people would like in terms of skins for the new champions and edits that do not change the cost of a skin that seem reasonable
BUT WHY CAN'T WE HAVE BUFF PIRATE ARMS ANYMORE? WHY MUST GANGPLANK'S GLORIOUS BICEPS BE SHACKLED TO THE PRISON OF CLOTH?

Kateykhaos, could you guys look into changing the passive particle colours of Spooky gangplank from a bright orange to maybe a dark cool colour like black or even something along the lines of purple to maroon in colour as orange for the flames clashes heavily with the skins palette.

You are active, sorry for lashing out, but other departments are severely lacking in this commmunication. I have to apologise as i should say "targeted" you for what others do.

Also, since you are responsible for skins. Isnt it your responsibility to also consider that some skins have unclear particles which makes skills harder to see and simmilar issues?

Or is it the responsibility of some other team?

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

But, my main gripe is with the rest of the guys. I dont know, maybe you have the power to get at least someone else from other departments to come to forums and talk?

Because our feedback on idiotic changes and nerfs from the balance department is simply ignored. Narrative team still hasnt done shit in about 1 year after retcon and refuses to even start serious talks about the new lore. Many threads are being ignored. Not by you maybe, but by others.


Again, sorry for lashing out at you specifically, you just represented whole riot for me at that time -_- . But my original point still remains, communication with rioters in forums is still incredibly weak.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=1GdEEhO2,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2015-07-08T18:47:03.051+0000)
>
> Thanks for posting this! :]

Or just give your customers a choice?

I think people will always be on the fence with traditional skins. Some people want them, other care not. To me, they're a neat thing to have. Example is how I find myself always swapping between Traditional Trundle and his new base. They're like a legendary skin, minus the different animations (I can't stand T.Sejuani's joke as the VO does not work with her new animations, whereas T.Trundle can get away with it as can T.Karma). I can understand why you guys stopped, as well as the fact that to make a traditional skin you must retain the old flavour and personality vs the new and improved feel.

Where was I going with this? Oh yes, point is I'm fine with the discontinuation of traditional skins. However I would like to suggest this: What about making traditional-legendary quality skins? Reimagine the old into something more sleek and fitting while giving them new and different VO and animations that pay homage to the original. An example would be Sion. Say you make a T.Sion skin that's legendary, you guys write whole new lines and a VO that sound like the old one (expanded beyond his 10 lines with a new voice actor that can hopefully get the feel of old Sion). This is merely a suggestion and if you like it, maybe try to bounce the idea off some co-workers. I used Sion as an example because he's the one people have probably complained about (I personally would like T.Sejuani to be a nomination for this as I stated my complaint before). Just an idea!

Personally, I find the new GP close enough to his previous originals(s?) that he wouldn't need a traditional skin. And as I said before, I'm fine with the disconutiation of traditional skins.

I dont want a classic gp skin but more of a retro one. I WANT THE GOLD GUN AND SWORD and the puffy chest hair was nice too. and stacking avarice blades and denying the cannon minion with e. *cries remembering season one gp* i miss that lovable oaf.

If I might recommend something that takes very little effort from your side and would satisfy many players who love the old voice lines of reworked champions: Traditional Chromas - a simple recoiler of the new model which uses old voice lines if selected. Green Sion with his Arnold voice back; or Gangplank with red jacket and jolly pirate attitude. And if you really want to win the hearts of players - black and gold Nasus with his legendary old voice.
They'd be given away for free to old champion players and paid for new, just as traditional skins.

A fine compromise, don't you think? For 30 minutes worth of work in Photoshop you get massive satisfaction out of the old players.

I personally prefered GP's old look over the new one. GP was kind of a fun, not too serious character, but this look oozes seriousness. Sure, it's badass and all that, but it just doesn't quite *feel* like a GP look...

Also that beard belongs on a DWARF, not a pirate, but that's a minor major nitpick.
Have you heard his VO yet tho? Its pretty good and fitting for his character, past and new.

I personally think traditional skins should be a must, they are not that much work (VO already made, don't need to create new stuff/idea) and for those who have played league for a while it makes us nostalgic. See the new GP for starters has this new weird black hat with that golden thing on it instead of being the same color tint has the coat, then his gun is an outrage, like really you make him more serious looking but give him that ridiculous gun?  Its like twice his head in size and just looks dumb. Now then for the rest of his armament: the cutlas (not sure if it is a cutlass but whatever) if you do a search on google image for Pirate sword your gona get both the old awesome large blade and his new sword  but you get a lot more large cutlas then the new thing and il say it: that new flaming sword probly would look dumb with the old large model but a thin sword like that is not the GP feel, it does not feel piraty enough. Then finally his coat, yes the new one is kinda cool but what is those big black shoulder guards? and why do we have sleeves? I will say this: the old coat was a used awesome coat that saw action, you could the usage of the coat, it was a coat that a dirty, hard real pirate at sea would have. With holes, wear and tear, a real big awesome belt that goes around it. That new coat is exactly what it is. a new not pirate coat with the fancy black and gold ornaments that has seen no action. Finally has a personal preference the old white shirt that actually cover his chest like a shirt should be doing looks just better. And for the last of my renting: the old goofy GP was/his more the champion he should be: an unpredictable pirate that takes nothing seriously and laugh has you get pummeled by his ships canon, a crazy pirate king with a crazy crew and a crazy boat from a crazy part of the world who does all of this killing and plundering for fun and gold. Il take the crazy pirate that has been in the thick of things (from the view of his old coat) anytime over that rich coat new guy. The new GP is not a PIRATE!!!! hes just a pirate. Really all im, no all we are asking for is our traditional skins and VO.

The gun is a staple of League. Everything is oversized and comical, and that's not going to change. I think they're supposed to look less like guns and more like hand held cannons, since League is a fantasy setting.
The majority of the large-bladed cutlass you find on Google Images aren't real, but rather characterized toys and cliparts. That's what a "PIRATE!!!!" looks like, but legitimate cutlasses are a lot thinner like the new GP's.
His coat has some wear and tear, and it's more suited to a pirate king than the previous one. Old Gangplank wasn't dressed like a pirate king, barely a pirate boss. He was more of a simple rabble rouser.
Overall, you're right, he feels different. New Gangplank leans towards a more serious, experienced and "Pirate king" type pirate. Old Gangplank was a younger, rougher and more "PIRATE!!!!" pirate. There will be fans of both, and whichever one feels better is based on your opinion. So yeah, bring on that traditional skin. Or maybe a post-Pirate King Gangplank, from before he ruled Bilgewater back in his youth.

A traditional skin wouldn't really change that much.Remember that the champs that receive traditional skins,still keep their updated models,so the traditional skin would essentially just:
-replace his red jacket with a slightly different red jacket
-give him a slightly different hat
-give him a slightly shorter and darker beard
-keep his old VO.
That aren't that many visual differences

However a traditional skin should be done if the champ in question gets changed so much,that his/her old design would be worth a skin on its own,which simply isn't the case here.
I miss his original carpet chest hair.

Even if they weren't done making Traditional skins I don't see why he'd warrant one.

I have mixed feelings about his current model on the PBE, it looks nice and really well made, but it makes him look pretty old. Still he looks a lot more serious and intimidating than the current Gangplank on live. So a traditional one would be interesting.
I also can't believe they changed his E ):

That's really a sad one.
Now he will be another "set up, wait, blow up" champ which the enemies can easily avoid. 

This will have an impact on his mobility. It will not only take away his movement buff, but also replace it with an ability which will make him sit around in a certain spot... and therefore further reduce his mobility.

His passive gives him in-and-out mobility for quick skirmishing, and his e is far from a slow setup ability. Look up videos of him on PBE, he's crazy fun and the barrel minigame is incredibly intense. It's like new Sion, you use the barrels to push your opponent under their turret and bully them out of their farm. Very matchup dependent (he destroys most melee champs early), but loads of fun and interesting gameplay for both sides of the rift.
